constantValues: Generic activity representing work needed to be done.
Type a short description about the objective or primary topic of the task.

arguments.explanation: This 'referencesA' relationship to the entity 'User and Team' adds the 'ownerId' attribute below to the 'Task' entity as a key
arguments.name: addedAttribute

constantValues: Enter the user or team who is assigned to manage the record. This field is updated every time the record is assigned to a different user.

constantValues: Shows whether the task is open, completed, or canceled. Completed and canceled tasks are read-only and can't be edited.

arguments.name: activityTypeCode_display

constantValues: Information regarding whether the activity is a regular activity type or event type.
Enter the actual end date and time of the task. By default, it displays when the activity was completed or canceled.
Enter the expected due date and time.

arguments.explanation: This 'referencesA' relationship to the entity 'KnowledgeArticle and Account and KnowledgeBaseRecord and Contact' adds the 'regardingObjectId' attribute below to the 'Task' entity as a key
arguments.name: addedAttribute

constantValues: Choose the record that the task relates to.
Scheduled duration of the task, specified in minutes.
Enter the actual start date and time for the task. By default, it displays when the task was created.
Type a category to identify the task type, such as lead gathering or customer follow up, to tie the task to a business group or function.
Shows the date and time when the record was created. The date and time are displayed in the time zone selected in Microsoft Dynamics 365 options.

arguments.explanation: This 'referencesA' relationship to the entity 'BusinessUnit' adds the 'owningBusinessUnit' attribute below to the 'Task' entity as a key
arguments.name: addedAttribute

constantValues: Shows the record owner's business unit.
Information which specifies if the task was created from a workflow rule.

arguments.name: addedAttribute

constantValues: Shows who last updated the record.
Type a subcategory to identify the task type and relate the activity to a specific product, sales region, business group, or other function.
Enter the expected due date and time.
Type additional information to describe the task.
Type the percentage complete value for the task to track tasks to completion.

Date and time that the record was migrated.

constantValues: Choose the local currency for the record to make sure budgets are reported in the correct currency.
Shows the conversion rate of the record's currency. The exchange rate is used to convert all money fields in the record from the local currency to the system's default currency.
Shows the ID of the process.
Shows the ID of the stage.
